title: Wait, what DQ has fixed seriously?
body:

less unskilled players? Hell no

Less toxicity? We can't know since premades don't use chat, i except more toxicity toward solo players playing with a 4 man premade for example.

**Dynamic queue has fixed nothing** , i really can't see what it fixed and further it brought several problems:

-"wtf is anoying lvl here" , we can't know WHO deserve what rank simply because of boosting... which has become **legal**???
-semi-pro lvl being completly fucked up because diamonds can't play as 4 or 5, SO you fucked up ranked 5v5 for the sake of dynamic queue? AHHHH my bad, i forgot that not every players are diamond.
-match making balance becoming non-existant, like how are you supposed to balance matches right now? remember when lebron james+wade joined miami and still lost despite being very good, because they still didn't have teamplay against good teamplay? lately i saw a lot of imbalanced mmr games...
-and finally solo players will live in hell now.

Yeah.. that wouldn't make those matches fair for the solo players.  It would just make people nicer.  The solo player is still at a sizable disadvantage in matches where premades show up... even when he also has one on his team.  Them being nice about it doesn't mean that DQ is good.  It still undercuts the entire point of rank by biasing towards premade players.  Ranked it supposed to be an even playing field.  If it wants to call itself a serious competitive thing, it should be trying to make the game as evenly matched as possible, not giving you an advantage over other people for bringing friends into the game... or giving you a higher rank if you HAVE a friend playing the game who can car you.

It's sleezy and dangerously close to pay to win.  It's giving in-game advantages to the people who riot thinks are bringing more people into the game.

we already had premades in rank its called DUO now anyway this is a team fucking game can no one get it through their heads that you need to nice to people and work well with them?If people werent so toxic being premade wouldnt be a big problem since you can easily express your intents and communicate with your team.But What ever i guess people just need to learn the hard way....That You cant do every thing by yourself in a team game!

Tell you what then.  ONLY let 5 man teams play ranked.  Then ranked will in fact be a proper showing of how well your team plays and your ability to work together.  

Right now, they're rating you on individual skill, in games that are not won by individual skill.

I'd consider myself a very nice person in-game, and someone that can adapt well to working with different people.  At various points, I've had the green, blue, and yellow 'cooperation banner' honor rewards.  

That said, I've had some bad experiences online, so I'm really cautious about who I add to my friends list in any game.  In about four years of playing League, I've only added two people that I haven't met in person.  

I do have a group of friends I play with, and we were glad when DQ first came out, but now that we've actually played it and seen how many flaws it has, a lot of us (myself included) miss solo-queue.  Solo was always my preferred queue type, even when I mained support and good communication with an ADC was required.  I held out hope that it would come back, but now I have little faith left in League overall.

Sorry to burst your little friendship bubble, but that's not what I play ranked for. I don't want duo partners, I don't want to find a group. I want to sharpen my own personal skill, and climb the ranks on my own. That is the test of skill this game had for the longest time.

And now that skill has expanded to "playing well with your team". It's necessary. Riot wants players to group together more often so they don't have to keep trying to strike a balance between solo queue nightmares (easily shut down assassins like Katarina and Rengar) and pro play where simple teamwork makes all of these champions useless.

They already had that mode.  It was called "normals".  If you wanted to play with friends for fun... you did that.  If you wanted to play ranked, you either got a team together, or you played solo.

Dynamic queue helped a VERY small percentage of players who wanted to play ranked with their friends, but who lacked enough friends to form a ranked team.  And I guess it helped boosters a lot too, but I doubt THAT was intentional.  For that, they took a huge, runny dump on solo players... who I'd imagine... make up the largest percentage of ranked players.

IDK I usually win when I'm with a group of 3 or 4. The new way to "climb the ladder" is to make plays that benefit the team, instead of plays that benefit yourself. this is the reason why I hugely support dynamic queue, because the dream of ranked is to get good enough to play on a LCS team, where playing with the team is what wins and playing for yourself is so easily abused by your enemies. before when ranked was easy to 1v9 carry, was just a miserable experience that achieved nothing.

That's pretty much the mindset of diamonds last season, a strong team oriented play style that benefits you in the long run. bronze-gold think it's all about them plays though.
Whereas I see the benefit of playing with a team (no matter how small) the system in place does nothing to actually balance games properly. There might be a shift in skill so the premades are generally better when up against a 5man, but now you're playing against people who are objectively better than you, and that's not a solution.

yes, the matchmaking system right now needs an update. but that isn't by the nature of dynamic queue, it is because the way the algorithms and the MMR system are making matches does not work with dynamic queue. 

IMO Riot just needs to rework the MMR and ELO systems, and/or rework the matchmaking algorithms. I think also, there are ways in which Dynamic Queue can be adjusted to make that easier as well.

DQ has created a lot of problems only to allow people to play with more friends in ranked, which I imagine is a very small percentage of people.

The folks who like playing with friends generally arent interested in the more ranked/competitive gameplay, and the folks who prefer competitive gameplay are far more interested in working on their individual skills than playing with friends.

This mode doesn't really make anyone happy, and ultimately doesn't work. You are taking away guaranteed roles AND the ability to take premades into ranked for higher Elos.  When you have to break the rules of your own system to make it work, you are effectively demonstrating that it doesn't.
It's fixed having a happy playerbase.

At least from my experience, toxicity has dropped significantly, as has the number of AFKs. I also have had a better solo experience because there is generally some team cohesion and i can play the more supportive jungle style that comes naturally to me. It also has allowed me to play with friends in a competitive environment so we can all help each other grow in our knowledge of the game.

Now bring on the downvotes. I welcome them with open arms.
How does dynamic queue reduce afks? i don't get it. IRL problems aren't reduced, and friends can still get angry and afk in premades.

They can but they are less likely to. One is less likely to leave friends out to dry than complete strangers. And it's far less frustrating if you are communicated with as to what the cause of the AFK is than if they just vanish on you. And it may be that i'm no longer getting frustrated with these AFKs so it just seems like there are less. But even if that is the case, it makes playing ranked far less frustrating. I've pretty much solo climbed from B2 to G5 this season and have yet to encounter a premade that has created a negative environment equal to that of soloQ. But as i've said this is just my experience and i could be an anomaly.

Toxicity has reduced, but so has communication. Premades often tend to isolate players unintentionally. They may not be trying to, but when they're wrapped up in conversation, they often get distracted.

But there is the opposite side of the spectrum. There are premades that embrace singular players and it heightens communication between all parties. I'm in no way saying that the system is perfect, It has issues for sure, but my personal experience has definitely improved since the start of DQ.

Well, when I play with my buddies, I always try to alleviate the negativity often associated with premades. Hell, I even support for complete strangers in bottom lane while my premade buddies are in the jungle, middle, or at top. I communicate with pings, take time to type, whatever I can to make sure you solo bros and broettes aren't left out in the cold. Forwarned, if you are toxic, we will mute and report you; there are jsut soem things that are inexcusable.

The only real issues with dyna are focused in the diamond and above scenario, but that is such a small slice that it being ignored at first was to be anticipated.
